item.title: How to use async-std
item.description: Now, rust has two ways to write async functions, async-std and tokio. Let’s first start with async-std. Add dependencies in Cargo.toml Note that attributes is used for #[async_std::main]. Filename: Cargo.toml [dependencies] async-std = { version = "1.6.5", features = ["attributes"] } Write functions Filename: src/hello.rs async main requires return a std::io::Result. #[async_std::main]asyncfn main()-> std::io::Result<()>{println!("hello world!");Ok(())}Build your code cargo run
